intro: Ainsliaea elegans var. strigosa, commonly known as the hairy ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a hairy texture that gives the plant its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The plant's ornamental value comes from its delicate flowers and attractive foliage.
